workflow_rationale: Adding new guided onboarding functionality using React Joyride to educate new users on platform features and IDEA Framework methodology. Pure feature addition without modifying existing business logic.

phases.name: Setup and Type Definitions
phases.description: Install dependencies and create TypeScript type definitions for tour system

subtasks.notes: Installed react-joyride ^2.9.3 dependency. Verification passed successfully.

Created comprehensive TypeScript type definitions in src/types/tour.ts including: TourStep, TourState, TourCompletion, TourCallbackData, TourAnalyticsEvent, TourFeatureTarget, and UseTourReturn types. All types follow existing patterns from profile.ts and diagnostic.ts. Verification passed successfully.

phases.name: Tour Component Implementation
phases.description: Build the core tour components and state management hooks

verification.command: test -f src/hooks/useOnboardingTour.ts && grep -q 'useOnboardingTour' src/hooks/useOnboardingTour.ts && echo 'OK' || echo 'FAIL'

subtasks.notes: Created useOnboardingTour custom hook with: tour control state (run, stepIndex, isReady), localStorage persistence for completion/skip tracking, auto-launch detection for new users within 24hr window, methods (startTour, resetTour, completeTour, skipTour, setStepIndex), integration with useAuth hook for user context, DOM readiness detection via requestAnimationFrame. Verification passed: hook file exists and exports useOnboardingTour function. TypeScript compilation clean.

subtasks.description: Create OnboardingTour component with step definitions

verification.command: test -f src/components/OnboardingTour.tsx && grep -q 'OnboardingTour' src/components/OnboardingTour.tsx && echo 'OK' || echo 'FAIL'

subtasks.notes: Created OnboardingTour.tsx component with: React Joyride integration for interactive guided tours, 4 tour step definitions targeting Diagnostic, IDEA Framework, Avatar Builder, and Brand Coach features using data-tour attribute selectors, custom styles matching application design system, handleJoyrideCallback for tour state management (completion, skip, step navigation, target not found handling), autoStart prop for new user auto-launch, exported TOUR_STEPS for testing. Verification passed. TypeScript compilation clean.

phases.name: Analytics and Tracking
phases.description: Add analytics tracking for tour events and user engagement metrics

verification.command: test -f src/lib/analytics.ts && grep -q 'trackEvent' src/lib/analytics.ts && echo 'OK' || echo 'FAIL'

subtasks.notes: Created analytics tracking service at src/lib/analytics.ts with: generic trackEvent function for any analytics events, TOUR_EVENTS constants (STARTED, COMPLETED, SKIPPED, STEP_VIEWED), tour-specific tracking functions (trackTourStarted, trackTourCompleted, trackTourSkipped, trackStepViewed), localStorage queue for analytics events with 100-event limit, createTourAnalyticsEvent helper for external use, type-safe implementation using TourAnalyticsEvent types from tour.ts. Verification passed: file exists and contains trackEvent function. TypeScript compilation clean.

subtasks.description: Add analytics callback handler to OnboardingTour
subtasks.notes: Added analytics callback handler to OnboardingTour.tsx: imported analytics tracking functions (trackTourStarted, trackTourCompleted, trackTourSkipped, trackStepViewed), added hasTrackedStartRef to prevent duplicate start events, implemented tracking for tour start (EVENTS.STEP_BEFORE on first step), tour completion (STATUS.FINISHED), tour skip (STATUS.SKIPPED), and step views (EVENTS.STEP_AFTER). Verification passed: grep confirms handleJoyrideCallback and CallBackProps exist in file. TypeScript compilation clean.

phases.name: App Integration and Auto-launch
phases.description: Wire tour into App.tsx with auto-launch logic for new users

subtasks.notes: Integrated OnboardingTour into App.tsx: added import for OnboardingTour component from @/components/OnboardingTour, rendered OnboardingTour with autoStart={true} inside BrowserRouter after ScrollToTop and before Routes. The component has access to AuthProvider context for user state and will auto-launch for new users based on the useOnboardingTour hook logic. Verification passed: grep confirms OnboardingTour exists in App.tsx. TypeScript compilation clean.

subtasks.description: Add data-tour attributes to feature target elements

verification.instructions: Verify data-tour attributes exist on Diagnostic, IDEA Framework, Avatar Builder, and Brand Coach feature elements

subtasks.notes: Added data-tour attributes to all 4 feature target elements: 1) data-tour="diagnostic-feature" on Dashboard stats card, 2) data-tour="avatar-builder" on Dashboard stats card, 3) data-tour="idea-framework" on Dashboard IDEA Framework section, 4) data-tour="brand-coach" on Dashboard "Ask Trevor Bradford" module wrapper. Also added matching attributes to individual feature pages (IdeaFramework.tsx, AvatarBuilder.tsx, BrandCoach.tsx) for consistency and future-proofing. TypeScript compilation verified clean. Manual verification: grep confirms all data-tour attributes correctly placed and match OnboardingTour.tsx selectors.

phases.name: User Controls (Skip/Revisit)
phases.description: Add user controls to skip tour and revisit from settings/menu

subtasks.description: Verify skip button functionality in tour configuration
subtasks.notes: Verified skip button functionality. showSkipButton={true} is already configured in Joyride component (line 245). Skip button styling defined in TOUR_STYLES.buttonSkip, locale text set to "Skip Tour", and skip handling implemented in handleJoyrideCallback (tracks analytics via trackTourSkipped, updates state via skipTour, invokes onSkip callback).

subtasks.description: Add 'Start Tour' button to user menu/settings
subtasks.notes: Added 'Start Tour' button to user menu in Layout.tsx. Desktop: dropdown menu item with HelpCircle icon between email display and Sign Out. Mobile: button in user section of mobile menu. Both call resetTour() then startTour() to restart the onboarding tour.

phases.name: Mobile Responsiveness
phases.description: Ensure tour works correctly on mobile devices with proper tooltip positioning

subtasks.description: Test and adjust tour on mobile breakpoints
subtasks.notes:
Implemented mobile responsiveness for OnboardingTour:
- Added useIsMobile hook to detect viewport size
- Converted TOUR_STYLES to responsive getTourStyles function with mobile-specific sizing
- Changed step placement to 'auto' for dynamic positioning that prevents viewport overflow
- Reduced tooltip width to 280px (vs 380px desktop) with maxWidth constraint
- Adjusted font sizes, padding, and button spacing for mobile
- Added responsive floaterProps with smaller offset and adjusted scrollOffset
- Memoized styles with useMemo to prevent re-renders
Build verified successfully.

phases.name: Testing and Verification
phases.description: Write tests and verify end-to-end tour functionality

subtasks.description: Create unit tests for useOnboardingTour hook
subtasks.notes: Test tour state management, eligibility checks, start/reset methods, and localStorage integration
Test tour rendering, step progression, skip functionality, and callback event handling

steps: Verify tour launches automatically on dashboard
Verify 'Start Tour' menu item allows revisit

subtasks.notes: Full manual walkthrough of onboarding tour with new user flow

parallel_groups.reason: Both depend only on phase-4, work on different file sets, can run in parallel

parallelism.speedup_estimate: Sequential execution recommended due to dependencies

acceptance_criteria: Tour launches automatically for new users

verification_steps.name: Development Server
verification_steps.expected_outcome: Server starts on port 3000 without errors

verification_strategy.reasoning: Medium risk user onboarding feature affecting first-time user experience. Requires unit tests for components/hooks and integration tests for full onboarding flow. No security-sensitive areas touched.

checks: Tour launches automatically for new users
Tour can be revisited after completion
Analytics events logged to Supabase (onboarding_tour_started, onboarding_tour_completed, onboarding_tour_skipped, onboarding_step_viewed)
Tour completion state persisted in user preferences or profile
